weather_report:
The morning light over Downtown San Francisco begins shrouded in a curtain of rain-soaked clouds, the city’s character softened under a blanket of gray. Visibility seems muted, a distant silhouette of the Golden Gate Bridge hinting at its presence through the haze, while the streets glisten with the remnants of earlier rains. A damp chill lingers in the air, with the breeze sweeping through at a brisk 15 miles per hour, carrying whispers of the storms yet to come. The day feels heavy with a promise of continued rainfall, likely to accumulate throughout the afternoon, cradling the city in an atmosphere that is at once melancholic and intriguing.

As the day unfolds, donning an umbrella and a waterproof layer becomes essential; warmth is found in layers, perhaps a cozy scarf wrapped snugly against the emerging chill. This could be a tender moment to nestle into a local café, cradling a warm drink as the world passes by, droplets tapping against the window panes—an invitation to slow down. Alternatively, one might wander through the blankets of mist swirling around the city’s iconic architecture, where the familiar turns new in this cloaked embrace. Whether lounging indoors or treading the quiet streets, the day reveals vibrance in the softer hues of rain, echoing a shared rhythm of life amidst the storm.
